The '''Wubizixing input method''' ({{zh|s=äºç¬å­åè¾å¥æ³|t=äºç­å­åè¼¸å¥æ³|p=wÇbÇ zÃ¬xÃ­ng shÅ«rÃ¹fÇ|l=five stroke character model input method}}), often abbreviated to simply '''Wubi''' or '''Wubi Xing''',<ref>This is the name used in Mac OS X</ref> is a [[Chinese input methods for computers|Chinese character input method]] primarily for inputting [[Simplified Chinese character|simplified Chinese]] and [[Traditional Chinese character|Traditional Chinese]] text on a computer. Wubi should not be confused with the [[Wubihua method|Wubihua (äºç¬ç») method]], which is a different input method that shares the categorization into five stroke types with Wubi.

Wubi should not be confused with the [[Wubihua method|Wubihua (äºç¬ç») method]], which is a different input method that shares the categorization into five stroke types with Wubi.
